intro: Sahagunia paraensis, commonly known as the Paraense Sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disc of smaller, tubular flowers. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded understory areas of the forest. Its botanical features make it an important component of the region's biodiversity.
